JUDGES: Javier Borrego Borrego;Karel Jungwiert;Margarita Tsatsa-Nikolovska;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Snejana Botoucharova
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . Administrative proceedings concerning compensation in respect of the livestock , fixtures and fittings

On DATE the applicant filed with ORG a petition seeking the determination of the person liable for compensation in respect of the livestock , fixtures and fittings . On DATE the ORG ’s competent regional department in GPE commenced administrative proceedings .
On DATE the regional department issued a decision holding that the municipality of PERSON was the person liable for compensation .

On DATE the municipality made an agreement with the applicant and a certain GPE on the provision of compensation . The compensation was to be allocated to the entitled persons by granting CARDINAL to the applicant and CARDINAL to GPE
On DATE ORG ( pozemkový fond ) and the applicant made an agreement on financial compensation in respect of the livestock , fixtures and fittings .
CARDINAL . ORG proceedings concerning compensation in respect of the livestock , fixtures and fittings
On DATE the applicant brought an action against ORG claiming that the compensation in respect of the livestock , fixtures and fittings was insufficient .

On DATE the ORG ( okresní soud ) dismissed the applicant ’s action . On DATE ORG partly quashed and partly upheld the first instance decision , and sent the relevant part of the case back to ORG . In the reasoning of its decision the ORG noted that the applicant had supplemented her action through her appeal in respect of the compensation for the property not surrendered , but not in respect of the compensation for the livestock , fixtures and fittings . ORG decision became final on DATE .
On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings . On DATE ORG ( krajský soud ) quashed this decision .

On DATE ORG decided that it was not territorially competent to deal with the applicant ’s action , which should be transferred to ORG ( obvodní soud ) . The latter , however , did not agree with the referral of the case to it and , on DATE , submitted the case to ORG ( městský soud ) . On DATE the latter held that the disagreement of ORG , that the case be transferred to it , was well - founded .
In a judgment of DATE ORG , to which the case had been remitted , dismissed the applicant ’s claims . The applicant appealed .
It appears that the proceedings are pending before ORG .
CARDINAL . Proceedings concerning the passage of the title to real estates
On DATE the applicant brought before ORG an action against ORG seeking to decide on the passage of the title to certain real estates to her and CARDINAL other persons .
On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings .

On DATE ORG quashed this decision and remitted the case to ORG which , in a judgment of DATE , rejected the applicant ’s action . On DATE ORG quashed this judgment and sent the case back to ORG which , on DATE , again dismissed the applicant ’s action .

On DATE ORG , upon the parties’ appeals , quashed the rulings on the merits and on the costs of the proceedings , and remanded the case to ORG which , on DATE , upon the applicant ’s withdrawal of her action , stayed the proceedings . This decision became final on DATE .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
